issue.title: lint and validate dependency metadata to reference dependencies with …

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: Has One Approval
labels.description: This PR has one approval. It still needs a second approval to be merged.

issue.body:
…a unique key (name or alias)

Report charts with the following bad dependency specifications as bad charts:

    dependencies:
    - name: foo
      alias: baz # ← baz used twice
      version: 1.0.0
    - name: bar
      alias: baz # ← baz used twice
      version: 1.0.0

    dependencies:
    - name: foo
      alias: bar # ← shadows chart below
      version: 1.0.0
    - name: bar
      version: 1.0.0

    dependencies:
    - name: foo
      version: 1.0.0
    - name: foo # ← chart with same name as above (although version or repo will be different, this will not work currently)
      version: 1.2.3

Closes #9169

Signed-off-by: Daniel Strobusch <1847260+dastrobu@users.noreply.github.com>

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [x] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body:
Thank you for the report, @dastrobu . I agree (1) and (2) can't have any practical use-cases.  (3) may have a valid use case and could be supported in future.

@mattfarina , is the following worth marking for v4 ?

```
dependencies:
- name: foo
  version: 1.0.0
- name: foo # ← chart with same name as above (although version or repo will be different, this will not work currently)
  version: 1.2.3
```
